entry.et: Middle English essencia, from Latin essentia, from esse to be is

def.dt: :the permanent as contrasted with the accidental element of being
:the individual, real, or ultimate nature of a thing especially as opposed to its existence a painting that captures the essence of the land
:the properties or attributes by means of which something can be placed in its proper class or identified as being what it is
:a volatile substance or constituent (as of perfume)
:a constituent or derivative possessing the special qualities (as of a plant or drug) in concentrated form
:a preparation of such an essence or a synthetic substitute
:one that possesses or exhibits a quality in abundance as if in concentrated form she was the essence of punctuality
:the most significant element, quality, or aspect of a thing or person the essence of the issue
:in or by its very nature :essentially basically was in essence an honest person
:of the utmost importance time is of the essence
:a translucent substance that occurs in the silvery scales of various fish (as herring) and is used in making artificial pearls, lacquers, and plastics
